attributes.action: Long COVID (Prolonged COVID symptoms) to be included under the Equality Act.
attributes.additional_details: Long COVID should be automatically recognised as a disability under the Equality Act so that employers do not unfairly dismiss employees and they are protected from discrimination and have a legal right to reasonable adjustments like longer rest breaks and flexible hours/duties.
attributes.background: Latest Government figures revealed that nearly 400,000 people have been living with symptoms of long Covid for a year or more. Symptoms include fatigue, brain fog and shortness of breath. These people need to be protected in their employment.

rejection.details:
The Government's guidance on disability under the Equality Act 2010 states that you’re disabled if you have a physical or mental impairment that has a ‘substantial’ and ‘long-term’ negative effect on your ability to do normal daily activities:
https://www.gov.uk/definition-of-disability-under-equality-act-2010

It is therefore already the case that under the Equality Act, anyone with a physical or a mental condition which has a substantial and long-term impact on your ability to do normal day to day activities is protected under the disability protected characteristic. This could cover people who have long Covid, where this has a a ‘substantial’ and ‘long-term’ negative effect on their ability to do normal daily activities.

You can read more about disability rights at work here: https://www.gov.uk/rights-disabled-person/employment
